TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider extends System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider

Docs.summary: Enables Windows authentication with client application services.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use client application services to validate users by using Windows authentication. To enable Windows authentication, you configure your application to use the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider> class. For more information, see [How to: Configure Client Application Services](~/docs/framework/common-client-technologies/how-to-configure-client-application-services.md).
After configuration, you can validate users by calling the `static` <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method. The <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method internally calls the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method automatically authenticates the current user and sets the `static` <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object that contains the current <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity>. If a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientRoleProvider> is configured for your application, you can use the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object to retrieve user role information from the roles service.
You can retrieve a reference to the current <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider> instance through the `static` <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.Provider%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property. You can use the membership provider reference to call the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method directly. Additionally, you will need the membership provider reference to call the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.Logout%2A> method, which is not available in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider> base class.
## Examples The following example code demonstrates how to use this method to authenticate a user by using Windows authentication. In this example, the value of the `static` <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.Provider%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is cast to a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider> instance. This makes sure that a <xref:System.NullReferenceException> will be thrown if you accidentally test this code by using another membership provider.
[!code-csharp[ClientApplicationServices#309](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ClientApplicationServices/CS/Class1.cs#309)] [!code-vb[ClientApplicationServices#309](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ClientApplicationServices/VB/Class1.vb#309)]

Docs.related: How to: Configure Client Application Services

MemberSignature.Value: public void Logout ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Logout() cil managed
Public Sub Logout ()
public: void Logout();
member this.Logout : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Logs out the user.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For users authenticated through client application services, the `static` <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is set to a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object that enables access to the configured role service. The <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.Logout%2A> method resets the <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A> property to a <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal> object that contains the current <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity>. After you call this method, you can no longer retrieve roles for the user through the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientRoleProvider> class. To reauthenticate the current user, call the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
## Examples The following example code demonstrates how to use this method to log out the user.
[!code-csharp[ClientApplicationServices#310](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ClientApplicationServices/CS/Class1.cs#310)] [!code-vb[ClientApplicationServices#310](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ClientApplicationServices/VB/Class1.vb#310)]

Docs.summary: Automatically authenticates the current user by using the identity supplied by the operating system.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you configure your application to use the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider> class, the `static` <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method will use this method for its implementation. The <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method automatically authenticates the current user and sets the `static` <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object that contains the current <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity>. If a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientRoleProvider> is configured for your application, you can use the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object to retrieve user role information from the roles service.
## Examples The following example code demonstrates how to use this method to authenticate a user by using Windows authentication.
[!code-csharp[ClientApplicationServices#309](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ClientApplicationServices/CS/Class1.cs#309)] [!code-vb[ClientApplicationServices#309](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ClientApplicationServices/VB/Class1.vb#309)]
